Neil Swingler wrote:
> There are other idioms for testing exceptions which will actually be supported by using clover.
> e.g.
> try
> {
>   somethingDangerous();
> }
> catch(Exception exception)
> {
>   assertEquals("message", exception.getMessage());
> }
> 
> in this case clover will warn you if the test passed but the exception was never thrown i.e. we don't need the fail any more because we've got clover

Hm. Has it hurt the team yet that you're now relying on Clover to run 
all your tests? I'd be worried about that.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
